almost double the performance of mine on Passmark
so yeah
8350 is marketed as an "8 core" CPU, but it's actually a 4c/8t and the threads aren't particularly efficient. I believe there's still a class action lawsuit still going on about them.
Well, technically, it is an "8-core"
It's just that it has 8 small cores with shared memory, but they aren't very efficient
Assuming I'm thinking of the right SKUs
AMD's philosphy hasn't changed too much, lol.  More cores now, single thread later ;P
honestly, I think it's the opposite now with Ryzen 3000
Yeah, it's got some blurry lines in there. 8 cores if you squint your eyes kinda deal.
because they said they worked particularly hard on getting single thread performance up
Yeah, but they're still trying to push out the "more cores is better" marketing harder than ever
And it's working!  Only took getting that ST performance up :D
Yeah, but they already had multi-core improvements, but the single-thread performance is what was surprising
the multi-core wasn't surprising
Single core performance is trash on mine lol. The multithread scores are still okay though.
I'm just bummed because it's Zen 1 all over again right now

People bought up EVERYTHING without even waiting for reviews
the fact that Ryzen 3000 prettymuch lives up to the hype bar a few percentage is really impressive imo
Pricing / availability is out the window
yeah availability is a problem right now, but this was a given
If the thing you want IS available, there's a good chance that it's being sold by a third party for a steep price increase
Yeah, even as someone who uses AMD, I was super tentative on my hype, but it's cool to see them deliver.
This goes for MOBOs and RAM

there's no way they could ship as many as people wanted because there was no way for them to predict how many people would go to each individual store. I can only assume that pages like Amazon and Newegg severely underestimated how many they needed.
Newegg, definitely
Amazon, eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeh.  Last I checked they only had a listing for the 3700x

they had a listing for all of them when I talked to a friend of mine not too long after I had woken up on the 7th
I've been thinking, I'll probably end up getting a 2070 super or a 2080 when the price is cut
I'm hoping to get an upgrade later this year
The extra money that will be going towards RAM / MOBO is one reason.  The other is the 2080 super will probably sell out immediately :/
Man, it's so hard... being this close to building a new computer, but not being able to do so :c

Was looking at a 2060 Super. Only use 1440p and it look like that would future proof me for a good long while. Maaaaaaaybe a 2070 super if I come across a ridiculous deal on Black Friday or something.
I'm going 2080 super just because I am going to start playing super demanding games on PC
And that should be more than enough to last 1440p for 5 years :3
Or not :P
As processing power goes up, so does graphical demand to balance it out.
Was looking at 2060 benchmarks and 1440p max settings were well beyond just "playable".
And I'm not one to why away from dropping a slider to get more frames over time.
Shy away*
I'm working under the assumption that if I get the 2080 super, it'll go maybe 2 years at most before I start dropping graphics settings to maintain at least 60 fps
4k maybe, but I don't much care for that.
I'm also using a 144hz monitor ;)
So every frame over 60 is a bonus (50, even)
Too much damned money.
Agreed

That said, 4k is still a bit of a ways off from being mainstream
Minimum 80 series, ideally 80 ti and up, or 80 in SLI.

That said, they're consoles, so the eye candy will be dialed back compared to what PC can pull ;)
Next gen has me excited regardless of whether it can or not. Supposedly PS5 performance is beating out GTX 1080 performance.
When I heard about that, my first that, "Well, there's another checkmark to support the rumored $800 price tag"
thought*

*inb4 costs $1000*
:ptv-snicker:
PS3 hopefully taught them their lesson...
PS4 is only $299, to introduce the next gen at much more than 2x the cost while the PS4 still looks as good as it does, it would be a kind bogglingly bad idea.
Mind*
There's only so much mass production can do to cut prices for consumers
Custom SSD (supposedly better performing than anything on the market), custom mobo, cooling, CPU, GPU, RAM
And they're talking about matching mid-to-high-end PC components in performance?
That's where software sales make the diff. They've taken losses on hardware before. I believe the PS4 has been it's whole life as well.
That's a rather risky gambit to keep employing each generation
Especially since Sony is under fire for controversial censorship policies
